summary: This document is a chain of emails from July 2019 between defense attorney Michael Bachner and an Assistant U.S. Attorney regarding the Epstein investigation. The emails discuss scheduling a 'reverse proffer' meeting, a subpoena for a witness (likely Ghislaine Maxwell) to testify before a grand jury, and the witness's intent to invoke the Fifth Amendment. The emails also reference the sharing of the 2007 Epstein non-prosecution agreement.

persons.name: Michael Bachner
persons.context: Attorney representing a witness (likely Ghislaine Maxwell) in the Epstein investigation. He is communicating with federal prosecutors about a grand jury subpoena and scheduling a reverse proffer meeting.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: Prosecutor from the Southern District of New York corresponding with defense attorney Michael Bachner regarding the Epstein investigation, a grand jury subpoena, and scheduling a reverse proffer.

connections.description: Professional correspondence regarding legal strategy, scheduling, and the status of a witness in the Epstein investigation.
Bachner is representing a witness (referred to as 'the client' and 'her') who has been subpoenaed to testify before a grand jury.

events.title: Proposed Reverse Proffer Meeting
events.description: A reverse proffer meeting was proposed to be held at the prosecutor's office at 1 St. Andrew's Plaza. The meeting was to involve the defense attorney and prosecutors, but the client/witness would not be speaking.

events.title: Grand Jury Subpoena and Fifth Amendment Invocation
events.description: Defense attorney Michael Bachner notified prosecutors that his client, if called to testify before the grand jury, would invoke her Fifth Amendment privilege against self-incrimination. Prosecutors had provided case materials including the Epstein NPA.

locations: 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007 (Office of the U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York)
keyFacts: A witness represented by Michael Bachner was subpoenaed to testify before a grand jury in the Epstein investigation in July 2019.
The defense attorney notified prosecutors the witness would invoke the Fifth Amendment privilege against self-incrimination.
Prosecutors and the defense attorney were scheduling a 'reverse proffer' meeting where the client would not speak.
Prosecutors shared the 2007 Epstein non-prosecution agreement (NPA) with the defense as part of their discussions.
The email chain indicates active grand jury proceedings in the SDNY Epstein investigation in mid-2019, prior to Epstein's death.
